Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
George Wood Papers on the Democratic Socialists Organizing Committee (DSOC)
Wood, George
Wood, George
TAM.822
.25 linear feet in 1 half manuscript box
1977-1981 George Wood is a former member of the Democratic Socialist Organizing Committee (DSOC), having served on the organization's National Board while living in Illinois. The George Wood Papers on the Democratic Socialists Organizing Committee (DSOC) (dated 1977-1981) consists of materials documenting the activities of DSOC from the late 1970s and early 1980s. Materials include correspondence (including correspondence between Wood and DSOC founder Michael Harrington), memoranda, and ephemera documenting organizational elections, conventions, conferences, and the formation of DSOC's international committee and education policy task force. The collections also includes issues of the DSOC newsletter Downstate Left. The collection documents the evolution of democratic socialist ideals and organizations in the late 20th century. Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.
Scope and Contents
The George Wood Papers on the Democratic Socialists Organizing Committee (DSOC) (dated 1977-1981) consists of materials documenting the activities of the Democratic Socialists Organizing Committee (DSOC) from the late 1970s and early 1980s. Materials include correspondence (including correspondence between Wood and DSOC founder Michael Harrington), memoranda, and ephemera documenting organizational elections, conventions, conferences, and the formation of DSOC's international committee and education policy task force. The collections also includes issues of the DSOC newsletter Downstate Left. The collection documents the evolution of democratic socialist ideals and organizations in the late 20th century.
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Conditions Governing Use
This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by George Wood in April 2023; the accession number associated with this gift is 2023.045.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; George Wood Papers on the Democratic Socialists Organizing Committee (DSOC); TAM 822; box number; folder number or item identifier; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Processing Information
At the time of accessioning materials were rehoused in archival boxes and folders, and described on the collection-level with a folder-level inventory.
Biographical Note
George Wood is a former member of the Democratic Socialist Organizing Committee (DSOC), having served on the organization's National Board while living in Illinois.
